About Adani Enterprises

Adani Enterprises Limited is a holding company. The Company is an integrated infrastructure with businesses spanning coal trading, coal mining, oil and gas exploration, ports, multi-model logistics, power generation and transmission, gas distribution, and edible oil and agro commodities. Its segments include Integrated Resources Management, Mining, Solar Manufacturing, Airport, and Others. Integrated Resources Management provides end-to-end procurement and logistics services. The Mining segment includes mining service contracts for nine coal blocks with a capacity of approximately 100 plus millinewton (Mn) metric tons per annum. The Solar Manufacturing segment is engaged in the manufacture of solar photovoltaic cells and modules. Airport segment is engaged in the management of airports. Its road, metro, and rail business are engaged in the development of infrastructure projects. Its data centers business is engaged in the development of data centers. ;

ABOUT ADANI ENTERP.

Gujarat-headquartered Adani Enterprises is among India’s leading multinational conglomerates. Adani Enterprises is the holding company for various firms under the Adani Group. Adani Enterprises started as a commodity trading firm and has grown to become one of the largest companies in India in terms of market capitalisation. The company’s story dates back to 1988 when Adani Exports was founded by Gujarati businessman Gautam Adani. Initially, the company focused on trading commodities such as agricultural products and polymers. 1993 was the year when Adani Exports, which would subsequently be known as Adani Enterprises, was incorporated. The following year, Adani Enterprises issued its Initial Public Offer (IPO). The IPO was a success and was oversubscribed 25 times in 1994. In the same year, Adani Management Consultancy Services was merged with Adani Enterprises. In the late 1990s, Adani Enterprises developed the Mundra Port in the Kutch District in collaboration with the Gujarat government.  In 1999, Adani Exports commenced its Integrated Resources Management (IRM) business and signed a JV with Wilmar Trading to set up Adani Wilmar. 2000 was the year when Adani Enterprises entered the packaged edible oil market with the launch of ‘Fortune’. Adani Wilmar launched its own Vanaspati oil product under the brand name `Raag' in 2001. Adani Enterprises also started a gas distribution business in that year. Adani Enterprises inked a joint venture agreement in 2008 with Chemoil, an oil trading company incorporated in Hong Kong. Adani Enterprises entered the cement business in 2009.  In 2010, Adani Welspun commenced drilling operations. In 2015, Adani Ports & SEZ, Adani Power and Adani Transmission were demerged from Adani Enterprises. In 2017, Adani Enterprises started the production of solar PV panels. In 2018, Adani Green Energy and Adani Gas were demerged. 2020 was a significant year for Adani Enterprises when it ventured into the airport business with a portfolio of six airports across India. In 2022, Adani Enterprises completed the acquisitions of Mumbai and Navi Mumbai airports. In 2022, Adani Enterprises entered the media business with the incorporation of AMG Media Networks. 

Products and services 

Adani Enterprises is the holding company of the various entities under the Adani Group which is a diversified conglomerate with its foot in sectors such as energy, agribusiness, airport management and renewable energy. Adani Enterprises also serves as an incubator for newly-established businesses of the Adani Group such as airport operations. Besides, the company is primarily known for its mining and trading operations, particularly in the iron ore and coal sectors. Through its subsidiaries, Adani Enterprises is in the business of selling agricultural products, airport management, cement production, developing data centres, defense manufacturing, developing digital platforms for B2C customers, energy production, road and transport management, shipping and solar power. Adani Welspun is a subsidiary of the company that is engaged in the exploration of oil and gas harvesting. Adani Wilmar produces edible oils. 

Listing 

Shares of Adani Enterprises are listed on BSE, NSE, Bangalore Stock Exchange, Hyderabad Stock Exchange, etc. It is a part of multiple indices like Nifty 50, Nifty 500, S&P BSE 500 etc.

Can I buy Adani Enterprises Limited shares on Holidays?

Can I buy Adani Enterprises Limited shares on Holidays?

No, shares of Adani Enterprises Limited or any other publicly traded company cannot be bought or sold on holidays when the stock exchanges are closed. You can only buy or sell Adani Enterprises Limited shares on days when the stock exchanges are open for trading. It's important to check the NSE/BSE holidays calendar, before placing any trades to avoid any inconvenience.
